meanings.definition: Any of two or more forms of a chemical element having the same number of protons in the nucleus but different numbers of neutrons.
meanings.sent1: An isotope of carbon has the same number of protons but different neutrons.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study isotopes to understand elements better.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was 'Isotope Night,' where guests dressed as different versions of elements.
meanings.sent4: Her personality seemed like an isotope, with different layers waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: In the lab, the glowing isotope revealed the element's hidden secrets.

meanings.definition: A variant of a particular chemical element which differs in neutron number.
meanings.sent1: The isotope of oxygen has a different neutron count than the standard form.
meanings.sent2: Isotopes play a crucial role in radiocarbon dating.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a new dish called 'Isotope Surprise' with unexpected flavors.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like isotopes, each one unique and distinct.
meanings.sent5: The isotope in the experiment reacted unexpectedly, surprising the researchers.
